series_description: This series documents protective buying (corridors) and hardship acquisitions for projects. This series may include, is not limited to: requests with justification from landowner to purchase, plans, agreements, and titles.

This series documents the appeals process concerning disagreements with any phase of the relocation process such low payments and too few or a lack of benefits. This series include, but is not limited to: plan sheets, photographs and audio tapes and correspondence.

This series documents the sale of real and personal property that is determined to be excess. This series may include, but not limited to: leases, inventories, plans, maps, titles, forms, deeds, reports and correspondence.
retention_statement: 3 Years after equipment, facility, or property sold or no longer in use

series_description: This series documents relocations or abandonments brought about by previous dam construction and not associated with a current project. This series may include, but is not limited to plans, agreements, deeds, and correspondence.
retention_statement: 0 Years after no longer administratively useful

series_title: General Right of Way and Parcel Files
series_description: This series documents the acquisition of property from landowners from the negotiation phase through relocation (if applicable). This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, agreements, deeds, titles, vouchers, resolutions, Certificates of Take or Deposits, and correspondence.

This series documents information provided to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) for reporting payments made to landowners for the acquisition of right of way. This series may include, but is not limited to: IRS Form 1099-S.
retention_statement: 4 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the negotiation and acquisition of a cemetery and the removal and relocation of remains. This series may include, but is not limited to: photographs, agreements, plans, correspondence, chain of custody, reinterment plan, and records of found remains.
This series documents work with a utility company to complete a project. This series may include, but is not limited to: approval plans, easements, inspections, billing materials, and correspondence.
This series documents real property acquired for right of way purposes, often capital outlay properties. This series may include, but is not limited to:survey plats, deeds, and correspondence
retention_statement: 0 Years after equipment, facility, or property sold or no longer in use

series_description: This series documents the qualifications of fee appraisers to VDOT work on an annual basis. This series may include, but not limited to: Title VI reports, resumes, copies of appraiser licenses, Appraiser Statement of Qualifications and and correspondence.
retention_statement: 1 Year after no longer administratively useful

series_description: This series documents agreements between VDOT and a railroad for projects that include railroad crossings or railroad property. This series may include, but is not limited to: agreements, plans, rights of entries, and correspondence.

series_title: Right of Way and Utilities Management System (RUMS)
series_description: This series documents property acquisitions for all projects needing right of way. This series may include, but is not limited to: forms and appraisals.
retention_statement: 5 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded

series_description: This series documents special right of way negotiations and acquisitions with property owners having unusual operating circumstances and/or organizational structures that require property mitigation. This series may include, but is not limited to: agreements, deeds, right of entries, and plans.
retention_statement: 0 Years after no longer administratively useful
